Package org.cesecore.certificates.ocsp

Interface OcspResponseGeneratorSession

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    OcspResponseGeneratorSessionLocal, OcspResponseGeneratorSessionRemote
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    OcspResponseGeneratorSessionBean
    public interface OcspResponseGeneratorSession
    This interface is used to generate OCSP responses.
    Version:
    $Id: OcspResponseGeneratorSession.java 22476 2015-12-17 13:01:45Z jeklund $
    See Also:
    OCSP Response Generation

    • Method Detail

      • getOcspResponse

        OcspResponseInformation getOcspResponse​(byte[] requestBytes,
                                        X509Certificate[] requestCertificates,
                                        String remoteAddress,
                                        String xForwardedFor,
                                        StringBuffer requestUrl,
                                        AuditLogger auditLogger,
                                        TransactionLogger transactionLogger)
                                 throws MalformedRequestException,
                                        org.bouncycastle.cert.ocsp.OCSPException
        This method delivers an OCSP response to a given request, as provided in the byte[] parameter.
        Parameters:
        requestBytes - a byte array representing an encoded OCSPRequest.
        requestCertificates - An array of Certificates from the original HttpServletRequest
        remoteAddress - Remote address, most likely extracted from the HttpServletRequest
        xForwardedFor - Value of X-Forwarded-For header if it was present in the request.
        requestUrl - URL
        auditLogger - The AuditLogger to use for this transaction
        transactionLogger - The TransactionLogger to use for this transaction
        Returns:
        a signed and encoded OCSPResponse wrapped in an OcspResponseInformation object
        Throws:
        MalformedRequestException - if the request byte array was invalid.
        org.bouncycastle.cert.ocsp.OCSPException - if OCSP response generation fails

      • reloadOcspSigningCache

        void reloadOcspSigningCache()
        Reloads the cache of OCSP signers.

      • reloadOcspExtensionsCache

        void reloadOcspExtensionsCache()
        Reloads the cache of OCSP extensions (including extension specific caches, e.g. the CT OCSP response extensions cache).

      • clearCTFailFastCache

        void clearCTFailFastCache()
        Clears CT fail fast cache. If CT is not supported in this build, then it does nothing.
